Html:
The short version is that WinJS apps in the store require their JS files to be UTF-8 with the byte-order-mark. The TS compiler does not currently appear to be outputting the BOM.

I've created an issue for this here http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/531

Can this please be fixed soon?
Thanks

I’d rather create an issue asking why the hell that’s a certification requirement for Store apps.
Sent from Surface Mail
From: onovotny
Sent: ‎06‎ ‎December‎ ‎2012 ‎00‎:‎19
To: mark@markrendle.net
Subject: TypeScript apps fail Win8 store certification [typescript:405737]

From: onovotny

The short version is that WinJS apps in the store require their JS files to be UTF-8 with the byte-order-mark. The TS compiler does not currently appear to be outputting the BOM.

I've created an issue for this here http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/531

Can this please be fixed soon?
Thanks

The answer to that question is in this thread:

http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/winappswithhtml5/thread/dd352270-8790-4b48-8492-17a4a6875e99

Performance.
